name: woodpecker-ci
description: Woodpecker CI is a self-hosted continuous integration system based on pipelines defined in YAML. It integrates with Git repositories, runs builds in containers, and reports results through a lightweight web UI and webhooks.
features: Pipeline as code: Define build pipelines in YAML files stored alongside your source code.
Git integration: Connect with GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, and other Git platforms for automatic builds.
Container-based builds: Execute each pipeline step in isolated Docker containers for consistency.
Parallel execution: Run multiple pipeline steps concurrently to reduce build times.
Secret management: Store sensitive credentials securely and inject them into builds as needed.
Matrix builds: Test across multiple versions, platforms, or configurations in a single pipeline.
Plugin system: Extend functionality with community plugins for deployments, notifications, and testing.
Webhook triggers: Start builds automatically on push, pull request, or tag events from your repository.
Build artifacts: Store and retrieve build outputs between pipeline steps or for later download.
Status reporting: Send build results back to Git platforms as commit statuses and pull request comments.
Multi-agent: Scale build capacity by running multiple agent workers across different machines.
Web interface: Monitor builds, view logs, and manage repositories through a clean web dashboard.
